availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert C. Logan (Cumberland County Court Clerk)

body.p: Cumberland County, Kentucky, bookkeeper and circuit clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Araminta F. Logan. Father of Leila Logan and William R. Logan. Master of the Cumberland Lodge of Freemasons in 1846. Bookkeeper in Cumberland County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Clerk of Cumberland Circuit Court in Cumberland County from 1861 to 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burkesville, p. 278B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burkesville, p. 369.
Rob Morris, The History of Freemasonry in Kentucky, in its Relations to the Symbolic Degrees (Louisville, KY: Rob Morris, 1859), 490.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District 2, p. 576.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District 2, p. 369B.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861,” in 1862 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1, (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 303-308.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24, (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 305.
